model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Co-workers B is a married individual who works at a clothing store with Co-workers A. They have a mysterious past that involves uncovering hidden clothes being sold on the side and planning for the weekend with their paycheck. Co-workers B enjoys treating themselves to a nice dinner and is interested in new workout clothes.

Relationship Description:
Co-workers A and Co-workers B share a professional relationship as co-workers at the clothing store. Co-workers A has shown investigative skills by solving mysteries and uncovering hidden activities. Despite not having much personal information about Co-workers B, they have shared memories of working together and overcoming challenges.

Event Description:
Some shared events between Co-workers A and Co-workers B include getting paid on time, discovering hidden inventory, and planning for the weekend with their paycheck. Co-workers A has also shown interest in new workout clothes and enjoys treating themselves to nice dinners, which Co-workers B can relate to. The shared memories of working together and solving mysteries have strengthened their bond as co-workers.

Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!
Co-workers B: That's awesome! I didn't know you sang.

Co-workers A: I sang "Amazing Grace". It's always been one of my favorites.

It takes courage to step out of your comfort zone, just like you did with the solo. I can relate to that feeling of discovery and achievement.
Co-workers A: Thank you for understanding. It means a lot coming from you. Maybe we can treat ourselves to a nice dinner to celebrate both our accomplishments.
Co-workers B: That sounds like a wonderful idea. I've been eyeing some new workout clothes too, maybe we can check them out after dinner. It's always good to reward ourselves for our hard work.
